info.headline: Frost Advisory issued March 06 at 9:12PM PST until March 07 at 8:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM PST MONDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 6 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures of 32 to 36 will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...For the Inland Empire, strongest winds will be below the Cajon Pass. The most widespread frost will be over southern sections of the Inland Empire. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from 2 AM to 8 AM PST Monday. For the Wind Advisory, from 4 AM to 6 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
